result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo Melvin Moss

defendant.name: Moss, Lorenzo Melvin
defendant.address: 8951 North Park Plaza Court, Milwaukee, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. The State of Georgia Governor's Warrant was served by Deputy Thomas Luty on today's date at 8:52 am. Defendant serving a revocation until November. Case adjourned, Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  State requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court on a status conference. State asked for an additional status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lorenzo Melvin Moss in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Georgia.
Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
